Making Compile-Time Guarantees for Matrix Computations

18 Feb 2016

Numpy is a great library, a core library of scientific computing in Python. However, without compile-time guarantees matrix computations, itâ€™s easy to push out code ridden with errors.

In fact, any limited wrapper around BLAS or LAPACK is constrained by deep stack tracebacks that are impossible to retrace.

For example, take the dot product:

info > 1

info < 1

Statically-typed languages like Rust have a the great advantage of providing compile-time guarantees for code execution.
